boat.construction_details: Pitch pine planking on grown oak frames
boat.full_description:
Mizpahwas originally a yawl-rigged Plymouth fishing Hooker, then in 1919 she was converted to cutter rig and re-registered as Venture, PH255, to serve as the Exmouth pilot boat. When she was replaced by a motor launch in 1934 Venture was sold on to be converted into a cruising yacht. In 1938 she registered with Lloyds register of Yachts by the McNabb family and renamed Gladimaris after the owner’s spouse, Gladys Mary.

After a restoration in England in 1966 that replaced her deck with western cedar, and gave her all new spars(spruce mast pine gaff, bowsprit and boom) she was shipped from Tilbury to Vancouver as deck cargo at the end of 1975. Here her restoration continued as the shearstrake was replaced with teak and new bulwarks were fitted. The interior was finished with exotic woods.

Gladimaris was still floating in 2024, but her new custodian has restored her original name, and is bringing her ashore for a thorough restoration that will return her to her original dandy rig with standing lugsail aft.
boat.name: Mizpah
boat.short_description: Originally registered in 1885 as Plymouth Hooker PH255 Mizpah
